cards.flavor_text: [i]Patrolling Tofnet Plains is a harsh, and grueling work, but finding new rifts is always worth the effort.[/i]
[i]“They hire Wurms to make the openings in the mountains and me to keep them safe.”[/i]
[i]As entities are born through the openings of new rifts, it is the Avakin's life work to help them into their world, often into their fold.[/i]
[i]Clan Mordel learned of death through violence. Clan Avlod learned of death through peace.[/i]
[i]“There is no room for you here, or anywhere for that matter. Be dispersed.”[/i]
[i]Quick response saves lives. Smart response keeps them going.[/i]
[i]The worldsoul failed to stop its entrance. Now, it patiently consumes the energy of the plane itself.[/i]
[i]The wild drakes often circle the skies around the rifts in unclaimed territory. Its often no surprise that those areas stay unclaimed.[/i]
[i]Point the flames only towards something you want dead, or someone you know can handle it.[/i]
[i]“I came all the way out here to find you. It had better been worth the trek.”[/i]

cards.notes:
!note hybrid
Vigilance
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a noncreature, exile the top card of defending player's library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play that card and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast that spell.

cards.flavor_text: [i]“You say I am alone, yet I am surrounded by those I can trust. Can you say the same?”[/i]
[i]“Do you feel the power surrounding you? Good. Harness it.”[/i]
cards.notes:
!note hybrid
Rework
possibly shift to GR

cards.flavor_text: [i]“In ages past, we failed to protect your world from a hunger that festers still among us. We must protect our peace from it.”[/i]
[i]“Learn well! The rifts will not give you respite, so neither shall I!”[/i]
[i]“Welcome to our first lesson. To start, survive.”[/i]
[i]“Solitude and failure may yet nurture a great tree of glory in the earth.”[/i]
cards.notes:
!note hybrid
rework
Possible shift to White/Green

cards.flavor_text: [i]Clan Fadove teaches its members the brutality of war and anarchy with their first lesson. They never need a second one.[/i]
[i]The safest route between cities is atop the back of a trusted drake.[/i]
[i]Those that work alone in the outlands are the best for a clan: They know how to survive where you shouldn't.[/i]
[i]Finding a lost Icon may have you finding yourself lost.[/i]
cards.notes:
previewed

Fracture — Once each turn, when you cast a noncreature spell, tap up to one target creature.

cards.flavor_text: [i]The strength of Wurms was found once the clans began to accept them.[/i]
cards.notes:
Find out if Ward 3 is too good here
!addtoken WhiteWurm;2;

cards.flavor_text: [i]Icons are often wary of clans, but the few that aren't have been known to save the lives of those they find troubled.[/i]
[i]On Vinimroth, there are tales of a hunger. A hunger so enthralling it holds one to feed it no matter the cost.[/i]
[i]The Fadove will never leave an escort behind, no matter the cost.[/i]
[i]To prevent war, one must learn how to protect peace.[/i]
[i]Fear the day when you've moved a sentinel to action.[/i]
[i]Partisans are meant to protect the few rifts that the worldsoul doesn't close. Meeting one means you've found that very rift.[/i]
[i]Vinimroth is not the place for those who flaunt their power recklessly; It will take every opportunity to prove that.[/i]
[i]They say all it takes is a look.[/i]

[i]The Elves lost their connection to green mana after being infused with Vinimroth's worldsoul. As a result, they used their collective knowledge of Urza's machinations to help empower the Avakin.[/i]
[i]Drakes on Vinimroth are both docile and obedient, often ready actively seeking riders for companionship.[/i]
[i]“What a cute foundling! What can I do for you?”[/i]

[i]“Loss is inevitable. It's how nature works. To gain no knowledge from passing is disrespectful to the dead.”
—Shivta, Avlod Clanleader[/i]

[i]“Some refused the doctrine that the war was over. Those are enemies of all. Do not help them, they refuse peace.”
— Multaph, Riftborn God[/i]
[i]The Avlod can get rid of anything; A hex or a parasite; Pay them some coin and it'll be gone by the morning.[/i]
[i]Shivta's warriors had been known to protect the respite with a ruthlessness beyond necessity. Even still, their heart bleeds when a single life is lost within their walls.[/i]

[i]Cross a clan and you may survive.
Cross an Icon, and you'll never know peace.[/i]
[i]Left for the crows is often the fate for those who betray their clan.[/i]
[i]To attune to an Icon is to prevent the inevitable.[/i]

[i]“You have aided us to end the war between Roduth and Multaph. Receive this as our own, and may Shivta bless you.”
—Kier, Acolyte of Avlod Respite[/i]
[i]“The blind eternities and the paths are a powerful force. They will [b]rip and tear[/b] your being to shreds. Respect them.”[/i]
[i]Learning how to open rifts is already difficult. Using them to your own advantage is an even greater task.[/i]

[i]“You were born here Icon. You are of Mordel.”
—Zoslera, Mordel Clanleader [/i]
[i]A patrol's purpose is a simple one: Protect the clan from outsiders.[/i]
[i]To attune to an Icon is to burn down your adversaries.[/i]
[i]An eye for an eye, a tear for a tear.[/i]
[i]Melodia's power flared in the middle of the camp. Within moments, the shamans within began to help Melodia control and mold it into a new form. In it's wake, Korna was formed.[/i]

[i]After peace was finally achieved, some broods were put into the care of the very
beings they were being raised to fight.[/i]
[i]You'd be hard pressed to find a way to stop a wurm that jumps from volcano's.[/i]
[i]Its best not to disturb a Wurm while it's tilling the land. If you trample their fields, you better have a fast mount.[/i]
[i]“The forests are recovering, and we will make certain that is stays that way.”[/i]
[i]The first tenet of learning in Clan Mordel is size magic, and who better to teach it than the wurms.[/i]
[i]“The Wurms desire peace. We of clan Mordel give them a home.” [/i]
[i]The elks often feel more mysterious than the elves. You can never tell what they're guarding, and if you try to follow them you get lost.[/i]
[i]Abandoned Wurm broods were common during the war, and many clans adopted them out of kindness. The favor was never forgotten.[/i]
[i]To attune to an Icon is to protect what matters.[/i]
[i]Mordel clan learned size magic from the very god whose form dwarfs cities.[/i]
[i]Raised by bears, educated by avakin and trained by the fadove.[/i]

[i]“It just came out of a rift and you're already considering how to cook it?” 
—Najael, Travelling Shaman[/i]
[i]Icons begin their life as entities, choosing a form given what they've first seen upon their birth. If one isn't available, they default to cats. [/i]
[i]After the Pinnacle had been lost to war, the surrounding areas slowly started to wither. Eventually, only desert remained. Still, life flourished.[/i]
[i]To attune to an Icon is to cleanse the land.[/i]
[i]Some rifts aren't worth entering, especially the ones that are modeled after Volcanoes.[/i]
[i]Uth, a city sunk by the effort of only four of Roduths guards still yearns for a hero to return it to the surface.[/i]
[i]The resplendants are one of Multaph's greatest achievements; Direct access to the leyline of the forest that it could not access itself.[/i]
[i]Sometimes all a scout needs to end a confrontation is their stature.[/i]
[i]Roduth's destructive magic was declared forbidden after the war, but his followers continued in secret.[/i]
[i]Ancient structures, built to protect the meek and destroy the brazen.[/i]

cards.notes: The Avakin are led to treasures all over by their Entities. In exchange, the Avakin use their powers to help them manifest into Icons.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Never trust those who fear the frostborn.”
—Urkial, Outlands Clanleader[/i]
[i]The worst of times often open the mind to new possibilities.[/i]
[i]Hiring a Mistblade isn't just a guarantee, its a commitment.[/i]
[i]Where a nymph would be born, an Icon takes its place.[/i]
[i]“The ground is rumbling more than usual today huh...”[/i]
[i]Consistently, you'll find its always better to not have a rift pointed at you when it opens.[/i]
[i]There are very few Icons that join clans, but the few that do are among the most powerful.[/i]
[i]“You are under the protection of Clan Fadove!” [/i]
[i]To attune to an Icon is to turn its power to your endeavors.[/i]

cards.notes:
“For the woods to build its own guardian...reminds me of somewhere...”
—Melodia, Voidtouched

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I have rarely met a creature I don't wish to meet again.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]
[i]Windows to the future, and other worlds.[/i]
cards.notes: !related Blessing of Faloden Woods<2>;Breaking the Mold;Dromencal's Respite;Due Dismissal;Dust to Life;Eternity Siphon;Mordel Patrol;Multaph's Riftwarden;Outlands Respite;Powerstone Claw<2>;Prismatism;Purge the Clanless;Razorshell Drake;Rift Burn;Riftborn Flames;Riftborn Paradise;Rip to Yesterday;Rip to Today;Rip to Tomorrow;Ripped into Eternity<2>;Rush Down;Suffused Memories;Triumphant Riftcaller;Waterspout;

cards.flavor_text: [i]We entrust the cats to keep our power safe, and in return, we give them our love.[/i]

[i]“You constantly vie for power, hope for success. You abuse the power of the eternities. I respect them, and as such, I know their strength, and how to take yours.” 
—Shivta, Avlod Clanleader[/i]
[i]Surviving in the wilds alone teaches many things, but most of all, they teach you that any resource can matter.[/i]
[i]“To rebuild our world, we must take action, no matter how small or how slow.[/i]
[i]To fight is to live, and minotaurs know how best to do both.[/i]

[i]“Train to live, Live to train.”
“Stopped from pain, Start again.”
—Mordel Clan chant[/i]
[i]And yet again, Vinimroth's strange magic continues to bring forth life from the immaterial.[/i]
[i]Trackers find what you don't want to see but need to know: Enemies, and where they're heading.[/i]
[i]“Out in the wilds, you won't survive if you can't keep your blade up!”[/i]
[i]Its best to trust that which gets you off the ground.[/i]

cards.notes: !related Abrupt Death;Aeon Awakener;Avakin Opportunist;Avakin Riftwalker;Avakin Shaman;Boon of Roduth;Conscripted by the Clanless;Cursory Casualty;Drake Wrangler;Ephemeral Ordinance;Evanescent Impasse;Fadove Initiate;Fleeting Ruin;Impetuous Eradication;Outlands Traveller;Prismatic Powerstone;Rebuke the Foul;Rifttouched Ursine;Search For Wisdom;Stalwart Resolution;Study the Rifts;Sublime Liquidation;Torch;Transient Eternity;Transitory Refuge;Untamed Drake;Urkial, Outlands Clanleader;Vanishing Resolve;Verem-Volcano Rumbler;Weight of Betrayal;

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I think that you'll find cats are often the best ways to stabilise rifts. This iconic skillset has cemented cats as the favoured form of most entities.”
-- Multaph, Riftborn God[/i]
cards.notes:
!center
!related Subdued Rift VNM;Kier, Acolyte of Avlod Respite;Path of the Rift;
!exportname Cat Token
Preview

cards.flavor_text: [i]Vinimroth is filled to the brim with strange and interesting places; Some are known to seemingly appear from nowhere...[/i]
[i]Wild drakes are definitely dangerous, but powerful fliers if tamed.[/i]
cards.notes: !related Aerial Roost<2>;Drake Wrangler;Outlands Bulwark;Path of the Roost;

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“...And after the great tear, that's when the Elves appeared. They ushered in the power that would be utilized for generations to come...”
— History of Vinimroth, written by Korna[/i]

cards.type: Legendary Enchantment Creature — Icon Elk God

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“And in an instant, a hole opened in the sky. Urza had torn our world, and left us to repair it.”
—Retelling by Korna, Vinimroth Historian[/i]
[i]If you hear a whisper, run. If you feel its touch, flee. If you hear its call, it's too late.[/i]
[i]A city sunk. It yearns to return to the surface.[/i]

cards.type: Legendary Enchantment Creature — Wurm Elk God

cards.flavor_text: [i]“I am Thargle, Son of Yargle! The paths have brought me here!”[/i]

[i]“I've heard rumors that the Elves aren't from our world. After traveling to the only known respite of them, I got my answer.”
— Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]
cards.notes:
!related Kaln-Ocean Cloak;Multaphs Respites Spellbook;Sage of Truths;Storm Bearer;
!token

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Ages ago, after Urza's actions tore the plane, the inhabitants created a reflection of him, his malice, and the gods, all completely unaware of the fact they'd done it at all.”
— History of Vinimroth, written by Korna[/i]

[i]“They wander from one wet patch to the next, occasionally returning to holes in the ground.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]

[i]“They are adapted to the deep ocean. How drakes manage to reach them is a mystery.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]

cards.notes:
It recycles what others cannot, it brings rest to those that refuse.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Deep in the snow peaked Outlands past the ruins of Multa, packs of Froststalkers roam for prey.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]

[i]“They've found a niche in the ancient battlegrounds encompassed by mist. No wonder they're so poorly documented.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched[/i]
[i]Deep under Verem-Volcano lies a hidden power...[/i]
[i]A heavy blade for a heavy task.[/i]

[i]Each passing moment it becomes hungrier 
still.[/i]
[i]And with one spell, an idea was traded for complete and utter removal.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Pathbound—{I}, Put a stun counter on a creature you control. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Vigilance
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature. Untap it.

Pathbound—{I}{U}, Put a card from your hand into your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
You may cast this spell as though it had flash as long as you control three or more enchantments.
Draw three cards. Scry 2.

Pathbound {I}{B} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target permanent cards that share a creature type from your graveyard to your hand.

Pathbound—{IG}, Reveal a card with haste from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Vigilance, deathtouch, haste
When this creature enters, up to one target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Pathbound—2. Activate only if you control no nonland permanents. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
[i]Fracture[/i] — Once each turn, whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gains flying until end of turn. If you cast your third noncreature spell this turn, other creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

Pathbound {I} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Enchantments you control have “{2}, {T}: This deals 1 damage to target opponent.”
Equip abilities you activate that target Mordel Combatant cost {3} less to activate.

Pathbound—{I}{U}, Exile three cards from your graveyard. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Whenever you attack, target player mills four cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Elves discovered Urza's destructive magic had brought forth a new power for the multiverse; and they were just as keen to proliferate it.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Pathbound—{I}{R}, Put a card from hand into your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Whenever this creature leaves your sanctum, you may exile cards from the top of your library equal to the number of cards you put into your sanctum this turn. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

Pathbound {I} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
This creature can't block.
Whenever another card is put into your sanctum, return this creature from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Pathbound—{I}{G} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
You may play lands from your sanctum.

Pathbound—{IW}, Exile a white card and a silver card from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Flying
Whenever this card leaves your sanctum, you may reveal it. If you do, create three traces of it into your hand.

Pathbound—{W}{W}, Reveal two creature cards from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Return target permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a finality counter. Exile Path to Restoration.

Pathbound—{1}{I}{R}. Activate only if you have no other cards in your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Add {I}{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.
Exile Path to Ages.

Pathbound—{IW}, Reveal a card with lifelink from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
At the beginning of your end step, if you've gained 3 or more life this turn, create a 2/2 white Drake creature token with flying.

Pathbound {I}{U} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
At the beginning of each end step, target player mills two cards. If a card with pathbound was put into a graveyard this way, draw a card.

Pathbound {I}{R} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Breach of Malice: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

Pathbound—{I}{G}, Exile a land card from your hand. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
You may look at the top card of your library at any time.
{T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land, you may put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may mill it.

Pathbound—{IB}. Activate only if you have seven or more cards in your graveyard. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
All creatures have deathtouch.
Whenever a creature dies, each opponent loses 2 life.

Pathbound {2} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Enchant land you control.
Whenever you tap enchanted land, add {I}.
{5}{I}{I}: Target enchantment becomes a 4/4 creature. [i](This effect lasts indefinitely.)[/i]

Pathbound {I}{G} [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Choose three cards from your graveyard at random. Put on into your hand. [i](The rest don't leave the graveyard.)[/i]

Pathbound—{I} or {1}{U}. Activate only if you cast a nonpermanent spell this turn. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Flying
Whenever this creature attacks, scry 1.

Pathbound—{I}{B}, Pay 3 life. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
When this creature dies, search your library or sanctum for a card, reveal it, shuffle your library, then put it on top.

Pathbound—{I}{W}, Sacrifice a token. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
When Fadove Reinforcement enters, you may return up to one target enchantment you control to its owner's hand.

Pathbound—{I}, Tap a creature you control. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Defender
[i]Fracture[/i] — At the beginning of combat, if you cast a noncreature spell this turn, this creature has flying and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
Pathbound {1}{I}{B}. Activate only if you have no other cards in your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Najael once more sent off one of the friends she made in the outlands. Both afraid and hopeful of their eventual return to the camp.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Pathbound—{1}{I}{R}. Activate only if you have no other cards in your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“In an effort to rid themselves of the clanless near their border, Clan Mordel sent their legions after the Outlands.”
—Korna, Vinimroth Historian[/i]

cards.rules_text: Pathbound—{IG}. Activate only if creatures you control have total power 3 or greater. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Outlands aren't a clan, but a collection of those who wish to be free of clans entirely. The Gurdians are their beacons.[/i]

At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card. You lose 1 life for each card in your hand.

This land enters tapped.

Pathbound—{1}, Pay 2 life [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]No eyes, no mouth, no mind, yet it hungers.[/i]
[i]Some paths are not traversed by going forward, but rather “through”.[/i]
[i]The blind eternities explode or something. Just make sure to fill in all three lines of text, otherwise its gonna look kinda odd.[/i]
[i]The grasp of the eternities does not let go so easily.[/i]

cards.notes: All things have purpose, and so too do all people.

“Docile creatures that seem to detect harmful intent almost immediately.”
—Melodia, Voidtouched

cards.flavor_text: [i]All it takes is a single mistake.[/i]
[i]The Blind Eternities warps all that it touches; A newfound power Melodia now had.[/i]

[i]“When the first of us entered the paths, they found nothing but a simple shrub. A thousand years later, it still stands.”
—Korna, Vinimroth Historian[/i]

[i]“The knowledge of the Elves was once forbidden. Our clan accepted their teachings.”
—Shivta, Avlod Clanleader[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Pathbound—{I}{I}, Put two cards from your hand into your sanctum. [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
Whenever a spell or ability targets this creature, its controller puts the top ten cards of their library into your sanctum.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Roduth left a select few to protect the secrets of Verem-Volcano.[/i]

[i]“When the world split, we watched as mana from deep within flow out and mix with what was left. In its wake, a fault, and silver mana proliferated across the planet.”
—Retelling by Korna, Vinimroth Historian[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Pathbound—{1}, Pay 2 life [i](As a sorcery, reveal this, then put this on top of your library from your sanctum by paying its pathbound cost.)[/i]
This land enters tapped.
[i]({T}: Add {I}.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Even now, nature mends the scars of Urza.”
—Roduth, God of Conflict[/i]

cards.artist: J Edward Neill and Annabella Red

cards.flavor_text: [i]The outlanders struggle against Clan Mordel and its leader Zoslera for their bloody campaign against the clanless.[/i]
[i]Even in its weakened state, the worldsoul still fought against threats Vinimroth couldn't see.[/i]
[i]Though the plane was strengthened by the worldsouls sacrifice, direct exposure to the blind eternities leaves its mark.[/i]
[i]Death is an extant form of life.[/i]
